key_title: Key to the species of Opercularia

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Rubiaceae

source.author: Thompson, I.R.
source.title: A revision of Asperula and Galium (Rubieae: Rubiaceae) in Australia
source.citation: From: Thompson, I.R. (2009). A revision of Asperula and Galium (Rubieae: Rubiaceae) in Australia. Muelleria 27:36-112.

leads.lead_text: Peduncles recurved to deflexed, mostly less than 1 cm long; seeds 1.5–3.5 mm long
Peduncles erect, 1–6 cm long; seeds less than 1.5 mm long; mostly north-western, but also just west of Port Phillip Bay
Stems shortly scabrous-pubescent or glabrous; stamens usually 3–5; seed with 2 ridges on inner face
Stems coarsely hirsute; stamens usually 1 or 2; seeds with a single ridge on inner face
Leaves subsessile, usually less than 3 mm wide, lateral veins obscure below; seeds finely wrinkled
Leaves with petioles 1–10 mm long, lamina usually more than 3 mm wide, lateral veins conspicuous below; seeds smooth or coarsely wrinkled
Flowers unisexual; branches rigid and erect, mostly 1–2 mm diam., terete; north- western Victoria only
Flowers bisexual; branches lax, mostly less than 1 mm diam., angular
Stems usually scabrous-pubescent, mostly 30–100 cm long; leaves mostly more than 2 cm long, dull; seeds compressed-ellipsoid, coarsely cristate-rugulose on outer face
Stems usually smooth, mostly less than 30 cm long; leaves less than 2 cm long, glossy; seeds compressed-ovoid, smooth on outer face
